pr_title: Skip attempting to retransform our agent classes

timeline.message: Skip attempting to retransform our agent classes and generated helper classes

timeline.bodyText:
Removing this would remove the question @mateuszrzeszutek raised about RunnableWrapper.
Injected classes can't be instrumented since they are injected themselves during ClassFileTransformer.transform(), so those are safe to skip, and sounds like are the culprit of the log spamming?
timeline.author: trask

replies.bodyText:
Yes, injected classes are the main problem.
I can remove this block but I suspect that it really doesn't exclude anything that should not be excluded. Here is the list of excluded classes from this block from startup with -javaagent

If you believe that this block should be removed then let me know.
replies.author: laurit

replies.bodyText:
I think ideally we wouldn't skip any classes during retransform that we don't also skip during normal transform (though I agree it doesn't appear to have any impact currently, it feels like it might lead to a hard-to-find bug down the road).
I'd suggest one of these:

add the same filter to GlobalIgnoresMatcher, explicitly excluding RunnableWrapper (and see if this is the only weird example like that)
remove this block for now and we can revisit another time (I think it's potentially a nice startup time optimization not to send these classes to retransform)
replies.author: trask
laurit

replies.bodyText: oh, nice find! I'll create an issue to track this
replies.author: trask

timeline.message: remove filtering classes base on bootstrap package prefix
